S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Communication information
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: The complex attribute provides the contact details for ships requiring pilotage services through one or more communication methods.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Current velocity
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: The complex attribute encodes the range of the velocity of a tidal or non-tidal current.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Directional character
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: The complex attribute defines whether the light is a moir? effect light and encodes the orientation of the directional light sector.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Feature name
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: The complex attribute provides the name of an entity, defines the national language of the name, and provides the option to display the name at various system display settings.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Features Detected
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: The uniform assessment of detected features.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Fixed date range
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: The complex attribute describes single fixed period, as the date range between its sub-attributes.
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:remarks: the sub-attributes date start and date end must be encoded using 4 digits for the calendar year (YYYY) and, optionally, 2 digits for the month (MM) (e.g. April = 04) and 2 digits for the day (DD). When no specific month and/or day is required/known, the values are replaced with dashes (-).

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Horizontal clearance fixed
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: The complex attribute encodes the horizontal distance

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Horizontal clearance open
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: The complex attribute encodes the horizontal distance

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Information
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: The complex attribute provides additional textual information that cannot be provided using other allowable attributes for the feature, and defines the language of the text string.
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:remarks: this complex attribute should be used, for example, to hold the information that is shown on paper charts by cautionary and explanatory notes.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Light sector
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: A sector is the part of a circle between two straight lines drawn from the centre to the circumference. (Advanced Learner's Dictionary, 2nd Edition).

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Measured distance value
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: The distance value indicated on a distance mark, or the distance between two measured distance marks.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Multiplicity of features
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: The complex attribute provides an indication as to whether the true number of features is known and, where known, the number of features.
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:remarks: the attribute multiplicity of features must only be used to indicate the number of entities of a feature that are co-located (e.g. 3 overhead cables suspended over a body of water between 2 pylons), and this information is considered to be of use to the mariner. Where possible, features must be encoded individually.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Orientation
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: The angular distance measured from true north to the major axis of the feature.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Periodic date range
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: The complex attribute describes the active period for a seasonal feature (e.g. a buoy), as the dates between its sub-attributes.
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:remarks: the sub-attributes date start and date end should be encoded using 4 digits for the calendar year (YYYY),2 digits for the month (MM) (e.g. April = 04) and 2 digits for the day (DD). When no specific year is required(i.e. the feature is removed at the same time each year) the following two cases may be considered: - same day each year: ----MMDD - same month each year: ----MM-- This conforms to ISO 8601:2004.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Radar wave length
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: The complex attribute describes the wave length, as the combination of its sub-attributes.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Rhythm of light
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: The complex attribute describes the rhythm of a light (or a light sector).

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Sector characteristics
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: The complex attribute describes the characteristics of a light sector.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Sector information
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: The complex attribute provides additional textual information that cannot be provided using other allowable attributes for the feature, and defines the language of the text string.
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:remarks: this complex attribute should be used, for example, to hold the information related to the characteristics of a complex light sector.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Sector limit
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: The complex attribute describes the angle of a light sector as defined by the subattributes.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Shape information
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: The complex attribute provides additional textual information that cannot be provided using the attribute topmark/daymark shape.
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:remarks: no formatting of text is possible within shape information. If formatted text is required, then an associated text file referenced by the complex attribute textual description must be used (see clause X.X).

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Signal sequence
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: The complex attribute provides the signal sequence for non-fixed lights.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Surface characteristics
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: The general nature of the material of which the land surface or the seabed is composed.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Survey date range
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: The complex attribute describes the period of the hydrographic survey, as the time between its sub-attributes.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Textual description
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: The complex attribute encodes the file name of a single external text file that contains the text in a defined language, which provides additional textual information that cannot be provided using other allowable attributes for the feature.
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:remarks: the complex attribute is generally used for long text strings or those that require formatting, however, there is no restriction on the type of text (except for lexical level) that can be held in files referenced by subattribute file reference.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Tidal stream panel values
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: The direction of the flow and the springs rate from 6 hours before to 6 hours after high water (HW) or low water (LW) at the reference tide station, at hourly or sub-hourly intervals.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Tidal stream value
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: A measurement of the direction and velocity of a tidal stream at a given time relative to the reference tide.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Time range
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: The complex attribute describes the active time period of an event (e.g. a bridge opening time), as the time between its sub-attributes.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Topmark
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: A characteristic shape secured at the top of a buoy or beacon to aid in its identification.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Update description
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: The complex attribute provides additional textual information describing changes made to an ENC dataset resulting from application of an ENC Update.
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:remarks: the sub-attribute text is populated with a brief description of the changes made when the Update is applied, e.g.: Navigational aids inserted Changes to depths alongside and new pontoons added

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Value of local magnetic anomaly
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: The complex attribute encodes the range of the local magnetic anomaly.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Vertical clearance closed
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: The complex attribute encodes the vertical distance from a defined vertical datum to the underside of a an opening overhead feature when it is in the closed position.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Vertical clearance fixed
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: The complex attribute encodes the vertical distance from a defined vertical datum to the underside of a fixed overhead feature.
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:remarks: in the case of cables carrying high voltages an additional clearance of from 2 to 5 metres may be needed to avoid an electrical discharge. When known, the authorised safe clearance (known in the UK as the Safe Overhead Clearance) which is the physical clearance minus a safety margin shall be stated, using the attribute vertical clearance safe (see clause X.X). vertical clearance fixed must not be used to populate authorized safe clearances.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Vertical clearance open
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: The complex attribute encodes the vertical distance from a defined vertical datum to the underside of a an opening overhead feature when it is in the open position.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Vertical clearance safe
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: The complex attribute encodes the safe vertical distance from a defined vertical datum to the lowest point of an electrical cable over navigable water.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Vessel speed limit
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: The complex attribute describes the speed limit for vessels in an area where speed is restricted.
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:remarks: the speed limit in an area may differ for different classes of vessel.
